sentences.english: Neither Maya tradition nor modern astronomy supports a belief in any such beam.
sentences.chinese: 無論是瑪雅傳統還是現代天文學都不支持這種觀點。

sentences.english: The big budgets astronomy projects bring can provide funds for education.
sentences.chinese: 天文學項目帶來的龐大預算可以爲教育提供資金。

sentences.english: The dates are, in fact, astronomical, astrological and astrotheological.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，這個日期是天文學，占星術和星相學。

sentences.english: There’s a difference between a telescope builder and an astronomer, of course.
sentences.chinese: 當然，望遠鏡的製造者和天文學家是有所不同的。

sentences.english: Astronomers say the newly-found planet lies in the middle of what's referred to as the habitable or Goldilocks zone.
sentences.chinese: 天文學家說這顆新星處在稱爲可居住區的中間。

sentences.english: Well, that makes sense, kind of, that Milton had clearly admired the astronomer.
sentences.chinese: 這可以說得通，彌爾頓非常崇拜這名天文學家。

sentences.english: Nibiru was described as a star by the ancient Babylonian astronomers.
sentences.chinese: Nibiru被古代巴比倫天文學家描述成一顆恆星。

sentences.english: Vesta was discovered in 1807 and immediately intrigued astronomers.
sentences.chinese: 竈神星在1807年被發現，並立即好奇的天文學家。

sentences.english: Sirius was astronomically the foundation of their entire religious system.
sentences.chinese: 天狼星是他們全部宗教系統天文學上的基礎。

sentences.english: Some astronomoers worked on purly theoretical problems and never use the telescope at all.
sentences.chinese: 一些研究理論問題的天文學家，根本不使用望遠鏡。

sentences.english: Both astronomers and astrologers agree on this bit.
sentences.chinese: 在這一點上天文學家和占星家暫時可以握手言和。

sentences.english: Astronomers watched the sky to see if they could find a new, faraway planet.
sentences.chinese: 於是，天文學家開始著手尋找這顆未知的行星。

sentences.english: First woman graduate student in astronomy.
sentences.chinese: 天文學學院第一個女研究生。

sentences.english: That’s Jupiter doing its cosmic job, astronomers like to say.
sentences.chinese: 天文學家說啊，木星在太空上班，這是它分內的事。

sentences.english: Astronomers suspected that the low-density gas permeates the filaments of the web.
sentences.chinese: 天文學家懷疑低密度氣體充斥在這個絲網之中。

sentences.english: The next step for astronomers is to find out if the diamond planet has rings.
sentences.chinese: 下一步天文學家試圖找到這顆鑽石行星是否有行星環。

definition: to break a code/to crack a riddle/to solve an enigma/a breakthrough
variant of 曆法|历法 calendar
ancient Chinese divination tradition (still in use today)
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
Feng Menglong (1574-1646), late Ming dynasty novelist writing in colloquial (baihua), author of Stories Old and New 古今小說|古今小说[Gu3 jin1 Xiao3 shuo1]
to be fired up (idiom)/to have one's blood racing
faulty wording/mispronunciation due to a speech defect
